library(tidyverse)
library(tidytuesdayR)

# Get the data

First, let's grab the data from the GitHub rep and save it in CSVs.

```{r Download, eval=FALSE}

tt <- tt_load_gh("2023-05-02")

tt_download_file(tt, "plots.csv") |> 
  write_csv(here::here("20230502/data/plots.csv"))

tt_download_file(tt, "surveys.csv") |> 
  write_csv(here::here("20230502/data/surveys.csv"))

tt_download_file(tt, "species.csv") |> 
  write_csv(here::here("20230502/data/species.csv"))

```

# Exploratory Analysis

Now let's begin by familiarising ourselves with this week's data. First we'll read in the CSV files.

```{r Load}
plots <- read_csv(here::here("20230502/data/plots.csv"))
surveys <- read_csv(here::here("20230502/data/surveys.csv"))
species <- read_csv(here::here("20230502/data/species.csv"))
```


```{r glimpse_childcare_costs}
glimpse(plots)
```


```{r glimpse_counties}
glimpse(surveys)
```

```{r glimpse_counties}
glimpse(species)
```
